- Marca dos diodos: Bridgelux;
- Efici√™ncia Luminosa: 30cm/780umol/15193lux e 50cm/666umol/13015lux
- Consumo Nominal: 150w/hora*


* Embora o consumo em w/h possa ser o mesmo apresentado por l√¢mpadas comuns de pot√™ncias equivalentes, o painel LED apresenta maior economia de energia pois √© um equipamento customizado que emite apenas a luz que plantas absorvem, al√©m de n√£o desperdi√ßar energia na forma de calor.


Veja mais vantagens dos Pain√©is Grow LED Full Spectrum:

- Dispensa o uso de reatores para ser ligado; 
- F√°cil instala√ß√£o, basta ser plugado √† tomada; 
- Pode dispensar o sistema de resfriamento na estufa, pois o LED n√£o gera calor.
- Emitem luz em todo o espectro necess√°rio para a fotoss√≠ntese;
- Economia de at√© 80% de energia em compara√ß√£o com as l√¢mpadas HID / HPS;
- S√£o mais seguros do que outras formas de ilumina√ß√£o;
- Criam um ambiente que exige menos √°gua;
- Dispensa o uso de refletor e reator.


 Saiba mais!

O que √© PAR?

PAR √© uma sigla que significa Radia√ß√£o Fotossinteticamente Ativa (do ingl√™s Photossynthetically Active Radiation) e designa uma determinada quantidade de luz, na forma de f√≥tons, que √© absorvida pelas plantas para a realiza√ß√£o da fotoss√≠ntese. O n√∫mero PAR √© medido em umols/s por m2 (micro mols de luz por segundo por metro quadrado), ou seja, um painel LED com PAR = 850 emite 850 umols de fotons de luz a cada segundo em cada metro quadrado da √°rea iluminada por ele.


PAR x L√∫mens

Para as plantas o mais importante √© que recebam luz nos comprimentos de onda que necessitam para fazer a fotoss√≠ntese, ou seja, a luz que elas realmente ir√£o absorver e transformar em energia. Essa luz √© designada pela sigla PAR (Radia√ß√£o fotossinteticamente ativa).

L√∫mens s√£o uma medida de lux que os seres humanos usam para determinar o brilho relativo a partir de uma fonte de luz, ou seja, √© uma medida baseada na sensibilidade do olho humano e n√£o corresponde √† mesma medida utilizada para a fotoss√≠ntese (PAR). Resumindo, lumens se referem ao que o olho humano v√™ e PAR se refere √† luz que as plantas v√™em.

Para um cultivo de ciclo completo, desde a germina√ß√£o at√© a maturidade, ser√° necess√°rio fornecer √† planta luz nos comprimentos de onda de cerca de 390 at√© 735 nan√¥metros (nm), bem como todos os comprimentos de onda intermedi√°rios. Equipamentos de ilumina√ß√£o que oferecem toda esta gama de comprimentos de onda ir√£o abranger tanto a clorofila A quanto a clorofila B, dois dos pigmentos respons√°veis pela fotoss√≠ntese nas plantas.

O espectro de emiss√£o de luz de um painel de LED s√≥ √© completo nos LEDs Full Spectrum, pois al√©m dos j√° conhecidos LEDs nas cores azul e vermelho, esta nova gama de grow LEDs conta com o apoio dos LEDs amarelos (quantum).

Al√©m dos comprimentos de onda nos espectros de luz azul e vermelho, a emiss√£o de luz branca e luz no espectro infra-vermelho e ultra-violeta, a qual n√£o √© vis√≠vel ao olho humano mas para as plantas tem influ√™ncia na germina√ß√£o e flora√ß√£o, contribuem para a m√°xima semelhan√ßa com a luz natural emitida pelo Sol.


O pacote inclui:

1 x Grow Led 150w E-27
1 x Adaptador E-27 para tomada nacional

O **PAINEL DRONE GROW QUANTUM LED 150W E-27 Full Spectrum** parece ser uma √≥tima escolha para o seu setup de cultivo indoor. Vamos analisar suas principais caracter√≠sticas:

### Vantagens:

metadata.title: Qu√£o bom s√£o as luzes de LED para cultivar cannabis? - Cultivando Sustento
metadata.text:
Em contrapartida, os LEDs fornecem mais luz no espectro precisamente onde as plantas precisam dele.

Enfatizando os azuis e os vermelhos que suportam tanto a fase de vega quanto de flora, os LEDs maximizam a quantidade de luz que pode ser fotossintetizada, permitindo que as plantas flores√ßam e se espalhem.

## Rendimento 

Escala de espectros avan√ßada ‚Äì Complementa os vermelhos e azuis com LED infravermelhos e raios ultravioleta e tamb√©m uma fonte de espectro completo, criando assim, o que se acredita ser hoje em dia a luz mais avan√ßada para as plantas.

Controle completo do espectro ‚Äì Permite os produtores personalizar esse espectro atrav√©s da marca√ß√£o de entrega de luz usando aplicativos personalizados.

√ìtica avan√ßada ‚Äì Radia√ß√£o ativa mais consistentes. Isso significa que mais f√≥tons s√£o entregues diretamente a planta proporcionando uma penetra√ß√£o de luz maior.

## Custos Reais 

> Outras luzes podem ser mais baratas que um painel de LED, mas at√© que ponto?

Custos de energia ‚Äì Quem cultiva ou j√° cultivos com HPS e HID sabe que a maior despesa geralmente √© a conta de eletricidade. Embora a intensidade das HPS e HID sejam maior, os LEDs usam cerca de metade da eletricidade resultando significativamente em mais luz por watt de pot√™ncia.

Custos de resfriamento ‚Äì Como as l√¢mpadas HPS costumar esquentar muito, tanto elas como as plantas devem ser resfriadas com ventiladores e dependendo da pot√™ncia da l√¢mpada se faz necess√°rio o uso de ar condicionado. Em contraste o LED s√£o resfriados internamente o que faz com que voc√™ economize dinheiro com eletricidade e possa ter um espa√ßo de cultivo mais silencioso. E como os LED funcionam mais frios, as plantas ficam felizes em ficar por perto deles.

Custos de manuten√ß√£o ‚Äì Como estat√≠stica podemos comparar a vida √∫til do LED que gira em torno de 50.000 horas para as 10.000 e 18.000 horas das l√¢mpadas HID e HPS. Al√©m disso, a efici√™ncia tradicional da l√¢mpada come√ßa a se degradar imediatamente e diminui rapidamente, enquanto os LEDs mant√™m a maior parte de sua pot√™ncia ao longo de suas vidas.

Custos ambientais ‚Äì Com sua taxa de vida √∫til mais r√°pida, as l√¢mpadas HID, HPS e tamb√©m as fluorescentes adicionam mais massa ao aterro sanit√°rio, tamb√©m adicionam toxinas, incluindo merc√∫rio. Al√©m disso essas l√¢mpadas s√£o mais f√°ceis de quebrar durante o manuseio, causando desperd√≠cio e liberando ainda mais toxinas. Como podemos ver ao nosso redor, o desperd√≠cio est√° cada vez maior por parte dos seres humanos. Por exemplo: ‚Äì no caso das fluorescentes, voc√™ precisaria de muitas l√¢mpadas atingir a efici√™ncia de uma painel LED.

## LED¬¥s s√£o F√°ceis 

> Configura√ß√£o r√°pida e pouca manuten√ß√£o 

Como a maioria das luzes tradicionais os LEDs s√£o plug and play.

No entanto, ao contr√°rio das outras unidades que exigem necessidades especiais de refrigera√ß√£o e ventila√ß√£o, os LED podem ser utilizados logo que forem adquiridos.

Com menores necessidades de eletricidade, √© muito prov√°vel que voc√™ possa configurar sua sala de cultivo usando as tomadas el√©tricas j√° existentes.

## 

## Cultivo indoor com LED caseiro‚Ä¶

hahahaha

Na verdade eu vou compartilhar com voc√™, que para fazer um painel de LED em casa, voc√™ precisa de conhecimentos em el√©trica e eletr√¥nica.

## Dica de ouro para voc√™ decidir entre LED e HPS

metadata.title: Cultivo Indoor¬†Ilumina√ß√£o ‚Äì LED, HPS,HQI e Fluorescentes
metadata.text:
#### Pontos fracos: Alto gasto com energia el√©trica, calor, dispon√≠vel apenas em 220v

## L√¢mpadas: LED

LED s√£o um tipo ilumina√ß√£o diferente das outras, porque usam tecnologia mais avan√ßada. Para emitir mais luz e nas cores espec√≠ficas que ser√£o absorvidas pelas plantas, frias e quentes. Atendendo a necessidade das plantas de Cannabis nos dois est√°gios: vegeta√ß√£o e flora√ß√£o.

Com baixo consumo de energia el√©trica, os LEDs emitem mais luz por watt de energia consumido e tamb√©m gera pouco calor, o que √© um ponto muito positivo, principalmente para cultivadores iniciantes.

#### Dist√¢ncia da luz: ¬†+/- 25 cm das plantas (olhar recomenda√ß√£o do fabricante)

#### Pontos fortes: Boa colheita, flores densas, pode ser usado no vegetativo e flora√ß√£o (os full spectrum), pouco calor, baixo consumo de energia el√©trica.

#### Pontos fracos: Alto custo de compra, geralmente s√£o necess√°rios mais de um para atingir o resultado de uma HPS.

## L√¢mpadas LED COB

COB (chips on board), √© uma nova tecnologia de encapsulamento de LED. V√°rios chips de LED s√£o encapsulados em conjunto, como um m√≥dulo de ilumina√ß√£o. Quando se acende, ocorre uma maior distribui√ß√£o da luz.

As vantagens do led cob em rela√ß√£o aos leds convencionais s√£o as seguintes:

  * Aperfei√ßoamento da efici√™ncia do LED
  * Dispersa o calor rapidamente
  * promove ilumina√ß√£o uniforme
  * prolongamento da vida √∫til do LED
  * espectro completo que ajuda na forma√ß√£o de resina

Com tamanhas vantagens, tem sido muito utilizado em cultivo indoor, com alguns algumas marcas superando a produ√ß√£o das tradicionais HPS.

## Luz para a fase de Vegeta√ß√£o(vega)

As luzes para a fase de vegeta√ß√£o s√£o as Fluorescentes, HQI e LED. As L√¢mpadas podem ficar um pouco mais afastada das plantas, mudas e clones precisam de menos luz.

## Luz para a fase de Flora√ß√£o

As luzes para a fase de flora√ß√£o s√£o as HPS e os LEDs. As l√¢mpadas devem ficar o mais pr√≥ximo poss√≠vel das plantas (at√© onde o calor n√£o atinge as folhas), para produzir o m√°ximo de flores, densas e pesadas.

## Import√¢ncia da Escurid√£o

As plantas s√£o seres vivos, assim como voc√™ e eu.

Por isso a noite elas precisam ‚Äúdormir‚Äù. √â nesse momento que elas crescem e realizam outras a√ß√µes importantes.

Elas precisam de escurid√£o total, durante essas horas de escurid√£o, (Imagine que voc√™ est√° dormindo e a porta do seu quarto est√° aberta, pela porta entra uma luz que bate bem na sua cara. Sua noite de sono certamente vai ficar prejudicada, n√£o √©?).

Durante a fase de escurid√£o, as plantas de Cannabis tamb√©m precisam de ar fresco e umidade controlada.

## Como identificar problemas relacionados a ilumina√ß√£o no cultivo indoor

[Image 2: cultivo indoor passo a passo]

##### Problema de falta de luz: Galhos e folhas esticados, dist√¢ncia muito grande entre os n√≥s, isso porque a plantas se alonga em busca de luz.

##### Problema de muita luz: N√£o acontece, o que acontece geralmente √© um problema de calor, relacionado a proximidade da l√¢mpada

### Exemplificando um problema de muita luz:

„Äê4‚Ä†Snoop Dogg‚Ä†pt.wikipedia.org„Äë comprou uma estufa de cultivo indoor completa, acompanhada de um painel de LED de 300W. Mas Snoop n√£o acompanha a „Äê5‚Ä†Plantandobem.com.br„Äë, e colocou a sua muda que tinha sa√≠do da semente 3 dias atr√°s a uma dist√¢ncia de menos de 10 cm do painel de LED 600w.

Adivinha o que vai acontecer?

As plantas v√£o parar de crescer, depois v√£o come√ßar a queimar as folhas e morrer. (Voc√™ pode reverter essa situa√ß√£o, aumentando a dist√¢ncia da luz)

Claro que essa √© uma situa√ß√£o hipot√©tica, pois o astro do rap e entusiasta can√°bico, conhece muito bem a maconha. Mas j√° aconteceu comigo (Porque n√£o existia a Plantando Bem)

## Aten√ß√£o: Agora, vou compartilhar com voc√™, 3 dicas essenciais para usar na hora de escolher as l√¢mpadas para o seu cultivo indoor

Volts: Existem 2 op√ß√µes, 220v e 110v. Voc√™ s√≥ precisa olhar se as tomadas da sua casa s√£o 110v ou 220v e comprar a l√¢mpada (e reatores) com os Volts iguais.

Watts: √â uma medida de energia el√©trica, que nas l√¢mpadas √© usado para denominar o consumo de energia.

Obs: Use no m√°ximo HPS de 600w, l√¢mpadas HPS mais potentes precisam de CO2 adicional.

## Como medir a efici√™ncia de uma ilumina√ß√£o:

[Image 3: guia de

Nesse caso, o LED √© o ideal para voc√™ nesse momento, pois ele n√£o gera tanto calor e n√£o precisa de cooltube

## Guia para voc√™ escolher o seu LED

[Image 4: cultivo indoor led]

Existem v√°rios tipos de LED, √© importante que voc√™ escolha um led para plantas. 

Mesmo assim, ainda temos tipos diferentes de LED para cultivo de plantas, temos:

  * Painel de „Äê3‚Ä†LED‚Ä†pt.wikipedia.org„Äë
  * Painel de „Äê4‚Ä†LED COB ‚Ä†blog.televigi.pt„Äë
  * LEDs avulsos 
  * V√°rias marcas e modelos diferente

Uma vantagem ao escolher LED para o seu cultivo indoor √© que eles funcionam tanto em 110 quanto em 220 Volts

### Mas qual tamanho do seu painel de LED? 300W? 600W? Veja qual escolher‚Ä¶

[Image 5: cultivo indoor led]

Depende do seu espa√ßo de cultivo, em m√©dia 600w por metro quadrado (Para LEDs na m√©dia de desempenho)

Como calcular isso? 

Comprimento X largura = Metros quadrados do seu cultivo

Ex:

Se seu cultivo tem 1 metro de largura e 1 metro de comprimento,

1,00 x 1,00 = 1,00 metro quadrado 

Voc√™ pode usar um LED de 600w, que atende o seu espa√ßo, embora n√£o fa√ßa mal usar uma pot√™ncia maior 

Outro detalhe √© olhar a taxa de emiss√£o de lumens, quanto mais l√∫mens por Watts, melhor (L√∫men/Watts) ¬†¬†

Lembrando que, sempre estamos falando LED pr√≥prios para cultivo indoor de plantas, n√£o recomendo o uso de outros tipos de LED

Veja aqui: „Äê5‚Ä†Qual a dist√¢ncia da luz no cultivo indoor com led„Äë

## Pain√©is de LED Full Spectrum, o que s√£o? Onde vivem? O que comem? Como se reproduzem? kkkkkkk

[Image 6: cultivo indoor led]

LED full spectrum √© um tipo de LED que emitem luzes em v√°rias cores absorvidas pela planta de maconha, por isso ele atende a fase de vegeta√ß√£o e flora√ß√£o 

Evitando a troca de l√¢mpada que ocorre no uso das l√¢mpadas Fluorescente, HPS e HQI

Existe um pequeno segredinho que eu vou compartilhar com voc√™s sobre os LEDs full spectrum:

Os Pain√©is de ¬†LEDs que tem a cor da luz mais azulada s√£o melhores na vegeta√ß√£o e os com luz mais avermelhada s√£o melhores na flora√ß√£o, mas todos os LEDs full spectrum atendem a sua planta em todas as fases

## 

## Cultivo indoor com LED caseiro‚Ä¶

[Image 7: cultivo indoor led]

Achou que eu iria ensinar a fazer um LED com os mat√©rias que tem na sua cozinha?

hahahaha

Na verdade eu vou compartilhar com voc√™, que para fazer um painel de LED em casa, voc√™ precisa de conhecimentos em el√©trica e eletr√¥nica. 

Pois sempre tem um risco ao lidar com a energia el√©trica, ainda mais se tratando do cultivo indoor, onde os aparelhos ficam ligados por 8, 12,16 e at√© 24 horas por dia 

Eu pessoalmente, prefiro comprar pain√©is de LED prontos. Assim, tenho um produto com garantia, que eu s√≥ preciso ligar na tomada (Praticidade vale ouro)

Algu√©m pode pensar assim: ‚Äú Esse cara que est√° escrevendo √© um playboy, tem dinheiro pra comprar um painel de LED, eu n√£o tenho‚Ä¶‚Äù

Saiba que n√£o, meu amigo. Para comprar meu primeiro painel de LED, eu tive que parar de ir para festas, parar de comprar maconha do tr√°fico e juntar dinheiro por 3 meses.

Mas o meu sonho era cultivar e foi isso que eu fiz‚Ä¶

Ent√£o, cuidado com o barato que pode sair caro. 

Prefira pain√©is de LED prontos no lugar de LEDs avulsos (A n√£o ser que voc√™ tenha a experi√™ncia em el√©trica e eletr√¥nica)

## Dica de ouro para voc√™ decidir entre LED e HPS

[Image 8: cultivo indoor led]

Depois dos elementos apresentando acima, d√° para notar de longe que LED √© mais indicado para quem est√° come√ßando no cultivo indoor de maconha, por:

  * Serem pr√°ticos de usar
  * N√£o gerarem calor (Evitando assim, necessidade de lidar com ele)
  * Economizarem energia el√©trica 
  * Serem f√°ceis de instalar (√© s√≥ ligar na tomada)

Agora a dica de ouro do cultivador, que escreve para voc√™:

Sinta se seguro para come√ßar seu cultivo usando LEDs porque valem a pena. Quando voc√™ estiver confort√°vel e cultivando bem, voc√™ pode adicionar uma HPS como experi√™ncia e ainda aproveitar o LED na fase vegetativa (o contr√°rio n√£o poss√≠vel)

Espero que esse post tenha ajudado a clarear a sua mente sobre o cultivo indoor com LED.

content_references.title: Cultivo Indoor¬†Ilumina√ß√£o ‚Äì LED, HPS,HQI e Fluorescentes
content_references.snippet:
#### Pontos fracos: Alto gasto com energia el√©trica, calor, dispon√≠vel apenas em 220v

## L√¢mpadas: LED

LED s√£o um tipo ilumina√ß√£o diferente das outras, porque usam tecnologia mais avan√ßada. Para emitir mais luz e nas cores espec√≠ficas que ser√£o absorvidas pelas plantas, frias e quentes. Atendendo a necessidade das plantas de Cannabis nos dois est√°gios: vegeta√ß√£o e flora√ß√£o.

Com baixo consumo de energia el√©trica, os LEDs emitem mais luz por watt de energia consumido e tamb√©m gera pouco calor, o que √© um ponto muito positivo, principalmente para cultivadores iniciantes.

#### Dist√¢ncia da luz: ¬†+/- 25 cm das plantas (olhar recomenda√ß√£o do fabricante)

#### Pontos fortes: Boa colheita, flores densas, pode ser usado no vegetativo e flora√ß√£o (os full spectrum), pouco calor, baixo consumo de energia el√©trica.

#### Pontos fracos: Alto custo de compra, geralmente s√£o necess√°rios mais de um para atingir o resultado de uma HPS.

## L√¢mpadas LED COB

COB (chips on board), √© uma nova tecnologia de encapsulamento de LED. V√°rios chips de LED s√£o encapsulados em conjunto, como um m√≥dulo de ilumina√ß√£o. Quando se acende, ocorre uma maior distribui√ß√£o da luz.

As vantagens do led cob em rela√ß√£o aos leds convencionais s√£o as seguintes:

  * Aperfei√ßoamento da efici√™ncia do LED
  * Dispersa o calor rapidamente
  * promove ilumina√ß√£o uniforme
  * prolongamento da vida √∫til do LED
  * espectro completo que ajuda na forma√ß√£o de resina

Com tamanhas vantagens, tem sido muito utilizado em cultivo indoor, com alguns algumas marcas superando a produ√ß√£o das tradicionais HPS.

## Luz para a fase de Vegeta√ß√£o(vega)

As luzes para a fase de vegeta√ß√£o s√£o as Fluorescentes, HQI e LED. As L√¢mpadas podem ficar um pouco mais afastada das plantas, mudas e clones precisam de menos luz.

## Luz para a fase de Flora√ß√£o

As luzes para a fase de flora√ß√£o s√£o as HPS e os LEDs. As l√¢mpadas devem ficar o mais pr√≥ximo poss√≠vel das plantas (at√© onde o calor n√£o atinge as folhas), para produzir o m√°ximo de flores, densas e pesadas.

## Import√¢ncia da Escurid√£o

As plantas s√£o seres vivos, assim como voc√™ e eu.

Por isso a noite elas precisam ‚Äúdormir‚Äù. √â nesse momento que elas crescem e realizam outras a√ß√µes importantes.

Elas precisam de escurid√£o total, durante essas horas de escurid√£o, (Imagine que voc√™ est√° dormindo e a porta do seu quarto est√° aberta, pela porta entra uma luz que bate bem na sua cara. Sua noite de sono certamente vai ficar prejudicada, n√£o √©?).

Durante a fase de escurid√£o, as plantas de Cannabis tamb√©m precisam de ar fresco e umidade controlada.

## Como identificar problemas relacionados a ilumina√ß√£o no cultivo indoor

[Image 2: cultivo indoor passo a passo]

##### Problema de falta de luz: Galhos e folhas esticados, dist√¢ncia muito grande entre os n√≥s, isso porque a plantas se alonga em busca de luz.

##### Problema de muita luz: N√£o acontece, o que acontece geralmente √© um problema de calor, relacionado a proximidade da l√¢mpada

### Exemplificando um problema de muita luz:

„Äê4‚Ä†Snoop Dogg‚Ä†pt.wikipedia.org„Äë comprou uma estufa de cultivo indoor completa, acompanhada de um painel de LED de 300W. Mas Snoop n√£o acompanha a „Äê5‚Ä†Plantandobem.com.br„Äë, e colocou a sua muda que tinha sa√≠do da semente 3 dias atr√°s a uma dist√¢ncia de menos de 10 cm do painel de LED 600w.

Adivinha o que vai acontecer?

As plantas v√£o parar de crescer, depois v√£o come√ßar a queimar as folhas e morrer. (Voc√™ pode reverter essa situa√ß√£o, aumentando a dist√¢ncia da luz)

Claro que essa √© uma situa√ß√£o hipot√©tica, pois o astro do rap e entusiasta can√°bico, conhece muito bem a maconha. Mas j√° aconteceu comigo (Porque n√£o existia a Plantando Bem)

## Aten√ß√£o: Agora, vou compartilhar com voc√™, 3 dicas essenciais para usar na hora de escolher as l√¢mpadas para o seu cultivo indoor

Volts: Existem 2 op√ß√µes, 220v e 110v. Voc√™ s√≥ precisa olhar se as tomadas da sua casa s√£o 110v ou 220v e comprar a l√¢mpada (e reatores) com os Volts iguais.

Watts: √â uma medida de energia el√©trica, que nas l√¢mpadas √© usado para denominar o consumo de energia.

Obs: Use no m√°ximo HPS de 600w, l√¢mpadas HPS mais potentes precisam de CO2 adicional.

## Como medir a efici√™ncia de uma ilumina√ß√£o:

[Image 3: guia de

- **Cultura Local**: Ela √© popular em √°reas rurais do Brasil, e seu nome vem da sua colora√ß√£o rosada quando floresce e tamb√©m por seu aroma frutado que lembra manga madura.

### Caracter√≠sticas:

- **Efeitos**: Como uma sativa, a Manga Rosa tende a oferecer efeitos cerebrais energ√©ticos, elevando o humor e aumentando a criatividade. Muitas pessoas a usam para obter um aumento de foco ou energia, al√©m de ajudar com sintomas de depress√£o e ansiedade.
- **N√≠vel de THC**: Embora n√£o existam medi√ß√µes precisas, ela geralmente tem n√≠veis moderados a altos de THC, oferecendo uma sensa√ß√£o psicoativa mais clara e vibrante. A presen√ßa de CBD tende a ser baixa, j√° que a maioria das sativas puras tende a se concentrar mais no THC.
  
### Cultivo:
- **Clima Tropical**: Como √© uma strain nativa do Brasil, a Manga Rosa se adapta bem ao clima tropical, sendo cultivada com sucesso em ambientes externos nas regi√µes quentes e √∫midas do pa√≠s.
- **Dificuldade Moderada**: √â uma planta que pode ser relativamente f√°cil de cultivar em seu ambiente nativo, mas exigente em outras regi√µes. Ela cresce alta e pode florescer em per√≠odos mais longos, com algumas varia√ß√µes dependendo das t√©cnicas de cultivo.

### Popularidade e Curiosidades:

- **Conex√£o Cultural**: Al√©m de ser uma planta de cannabis, o nome "Manga Rosa" √© tamb√©m associado a uma fruta tropical popular no Brasil, o que torna a strain ainda mais envolta em uma aura de autenticidade e ra√≠zes brasileiras.

como calcular um desconto de 15% sobre um preco?

Para calcular um desconto de 15% sobre um pre√ßo, siga estes passos:

1. **Identifique o pre√ßo original**: Vamos chamar isso de \( P \).

2. **Calcule o valor do desconto**: Multiplique o pre√ßo original por 15% (ou 0,15).
   \[
   \text{Desconto} = P \times 0{,}15
   \]

3. **Subtraia o valor do desconto do pre√ßo original**: 
   \[
   \text{Pre√ßo com desconto} = P - (\text{Desconto})
   \]
   
### Exemplo:
Se o pre√ßo original for 100 reais:

1. \( P = 100 \)
2. \( \text{Desconto} = 100 \times 0{,}15 = 15 \) reais
3. \( \text{Pre√ßo com desconto} = 100 - 15 = 85 \) reais

Ent√£o, o pre√ßo com o desconto aplicado seria 85 reais.

Se precisar de ajuda para calcular um pre√ßo espec√≠fico, posso te ajudar!

import pandas as pd

# List of products and prices with max quantities and prices
data = {
    "Product": [
        "Prensado (60g)", "Soltinho de Baunilha (30g)", "Manga Rosa (30g)", 
        "Col√¥mbia Gold (10g)", "Afeghan Kush (5g)", "Girl Scout Cookies (10g)", 
        "Haxixe Marron (9g)", "Haxixe Dry (20g)", "Ice Kalifa (20g)", 
        "Meleca Wax (10g)", "Refil THC (3 un.)", "Vaporizador Airis (1 un.)", 
        "CBD Oil (60ml)", "Lol√≥ Cloroforme (300ml)", "Escama (3g)", 
        "Exporta√ß√£o (10g)", "Papel Flor da Vida (10un.)", "Papel Abacaxi (3un.)", 
        "Papel Fly Pig (3un.)", "Papel Tup√£ (3un.)", "Papel Jesus (3un.)", 
        "Micro-ponto (10un.)", "Bala Granada (10un.)", "MD Europeu (10g)", 
        "Cogumelo Cambojia Gold (10g)", "Seda (2un.)", "Piteira de Vidro (2un.)", 
        "Tabaco Org√¢nico (2un.)"
    ],
    "Price Max Qty": [
        200, 450, 450, 250, 280, 800, 270, 900, 1800, 1450, 850, 300, 700, 180, 150, 700, 
        350, 150, 210, 220, 250, 360, 500, 700, 200, 10, 30, 50
    ],
    "Price Next Lower Qty": [
        130, 270, 270, 150, 180, 400, 190, 500, 950, 800, 650, None, 360, 140, 120, 380, 
        120, 120, 160, 160, 180, 200, 300, 350, 130, 6, 20, 30
    ]
}

# Create DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Calculate discount percentage
df["Discount %"] = ((df["Price Next Lower Qty"] - df["Price Max Qty"]) / df["Price Next Lower Qty"]) * 100

# Handle cases with None (for Vaporizador which doesn't have a lower quantity to compare)
df["Discount %"] = df["Discount %"].fillna(0)

# Display the dataframe with calculated discounts
import ace_tools as tools; tools.display_dataframe_to_user(name="Discounts per Item", dataframe=df)

df

parts:
Eu calculei o percentual de desconto para cada item ao comprar a quantidade m√°xima dispon√≠vel. Voc√™ pode ver a tabela com todos os detalhes, mas alguns exemplos de descontos s√£o:

- Prensado (60g): **53.85%**
- Soltinho de Baunilha (30g): **66.67%**
- Haxixe Marron (9g): **42.11%**
- Ice Kalifa (20g): **89.47%**

Esses valores indicam o quanto voc√™ economiza, em m√©dia, ao optar pela quantidade m√°xima em compara√ß√£o √† pr√≥xima menor quantidade.
Como o desconto foi calculado?

O c√°lculo do desconto foi feito comparando o pre√ßo da quantidade m√°xima com o pre√ßo da pr√≥xima quantidade menor dispon√≠vel para o mesmo item. O desconto percentual foi obtido pela f√≥rmula:

\[
\text{Desconto (\%)} = \frac{\text{Pre√ßo da Pr√≥xima Menor Quantidade} - \text{Pre√ßo da Quantidade M√°xima}}{\text{Pre√ßo da Pr√≥xima Menor Quantidade}} \times 100
\]

Aqui est√° um exemplo para explicar o c√°lculo:

**Prensado (60g)**:
- Pre√ßo da quantidade m√°xima (60g): \$200
- Pre√ßo da pr√≥xima quantidade menor (40g): \$130

O c√°lculo seria:

\[
\frac{130 - 200}{130} \times 100 = -53.85\%
\]

O valor negativo indica que o pre√ßo da quantidade m√°xima √© mais barato, ou seja, voc√™ est√° recebendo um desconto de **53.85%** ao comprar a quantidade m√°xima em vez de 40g.

Esse processo foi repetido para cada item com suas respectivas quantidades e pre√ßos.

explain to the most popular types of of cannabis terpenes

Cannabis terpenes are aromatic compounds found in the cannabis plant that contribute to its distinctive smell, flavor, and potential therapeutic effects. They play a significant role in differentiating strains and can also interact with cannabinoids like THC and CBD to enhance or modify their effects, a phenomenon known as the "entourage effect." Here are some of the most popular cannabis terpenes:

### 1. **Myrcene**
   - **Aroma:** Earthy, musky, with a hint of fruity sweetness.
   - **Effects:** Known for its sedative, relaxing effects, often contributing to the "couch-lock" feeling. It's the most common terpene in modern cannabis strains.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Anti-inflammatory, analgesic (pain relief), and may help with muscle relaxation and sleep.

### 2. **Limonene**
   - **Aroma:** Citrusy, reminiscent of lemons and other citrus fruits.
   - **Effects:** Uplifting and energizing, commonly found in strains with a more euphoric or mood-boosting effect.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Stress relief, antidepressant properties, and may have anti-anxiety effects. It also has antibacterial and antifungal properties.

### 3. **Caryophyllene**
   - **Aroma:** Spicy, peppery, with hints of cloves and wood.
   - **Effects:** Known for its anti-inflammatory properties, it can also be calming and soothing. Interestingly, caryophyllene interacts with the body‚Äôs CB2 receptors, making it a unique terpene with potential medicinal benefits.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and may help with anxiety and depression.

### 4. **Pinene**
   - **Aroma:** Pine-like, fresh, with earthy undertones.
   - **Effects:** Often associated with alertness, focus, and improved memory. Pinene is believed to counteract some of the short-term memory impairment caused by THC.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Bronchodilator (may improve airflow to lungs), anti-inflammatory, and can help with memory retention.

### 5. **Linalool**
   - **Aroma:** Floral, lavender-like, with slight spiciness.
   - **Effects:** Calming and sedative, known for promoting relaxation and sleep.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Anti-anxiety, anti-inflammatory, and analgesic properties. It‚Äôs often used in aromatherapy for stress relief.

### 6. **Humulene**
   - **Aroma:** Woody, earthy, with subtle spice.
   - **Effects:** Anti-inflammatory and appetite suppressant. Humulene is found in hops, so it shares similarities with the scent of beer.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Anti-inflammatory, anti-bacterial, and may act as an appetite suppressant, making it unique among cannabis terpenes.

### 7. **Terpinolene**
   - **Aroma:** A mix of piney, floral, and herbal scents with citrusy undertones.
   - **Effects:** Uplifting and mildly sedative, often found in strains that promote creativity or a mellow high.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Antioxidant, anti-bacterial, and may have anti-cancer properties.

### 8. **Ocimene**
   - **Aroma:** Sweet, herbal, with a hint of citrus.
   - **Effects:** Energetic and uplifting, often found in sativa-dominant strains.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Antiviral, anti-inflammatory, and decongestant properties.

### 9. **Bisabolol**
   - **Aroma:** Floral, sweet, and slightly herbal.
   - **Effects:** Known for its calming and skin-soothing properties.
   - **Potential Benefits:** Anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, antimicrobial, and may aid in wound healing.

Each cannabis strain can have a unique terpene profile, creating different effects and flavors. The combination of terpenes and cannabinoids helps define the overall experience of each strain.
regarding the potential benefits, can you be more specific on the degree of scientific studies behind each benefit?

The potential benefits of cannabis terpenes are based on a combination of scientific research and anecdotal evidence. However, the degree of scientific validation varies for each terpene. Here‚Äôs a more detailed look at the evidence behind the potential benefits of some of the most popular cannabis terpenes:

### 1. **Myrcene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Myrcene has been studied for its **sedative** effects in animal models, showing muscle relaxant and sleep-promoting properties, particularly in relation to **sleep aids**. It has been noted to enhance the effects of cannabinoids like THC, potentially contributing to "couch-lock" effects.
   - **Degree of Research:** Moderate. While studies in animal models (like rats) support its analgesic and sedative properties, there is a lack of robust human clinical trials.
   - **Studies:** A study published in the *Journal of Phytotherapy Research* demonstrated myrcene's analgesic effects when used in combination with cannabinoids .

### 2. **Limonene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Limonene has been researched for its **anti-anxiety** and **anti-depressant** properties. In animal studies, it has shown promise as a **mood enhancer** and stress reliever. It is also known to have **antimicrobial** and **antifungal** properties, confirmed in lab-based studies.
   - **Degree of Research:** Strong. Multiple preclinical studies support its anti-anxiety effects, and early-stage clinical trials have suggested potential as an anti-depressant, but more human studies are needed.
   - **Studies:** A study in *Advances in Experimental Medicine and Biology* reviewed the neuroprotective and anti-anxiety effects of limonene .

### 3. **Caryophyllene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Caryophyllene is unique as it can bind directly to **CB2 receptors** in the endocannabinoid system, making it more of a **phytocannabinoid**. It has shown anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties in both preclinical and early human studies. There‚Äôs also evidence suggesting it could help in managing **chronic pain** and anxiety.
   - **Degree of Research:** Moderate to strong. Caryophyllene has been studied for its role in pain management and inflammation, but human studies are still in early stages.
   - **Studies:** A study in *Pharmacology & Pharmacy* highlighted its anti-inflammatory effects through CB2 receptor activation .

### 4. **Pinene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Pinene is known for its **bronchodilator** properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine (like in treating asthma), and **anti-inflammatory** effects. However, its potential to **counteract memory loss** associated with THC is still largely anecdotal and lacks sufficient clinical validation.
   - **Degree of Research:** Moderate. While animal studies support its bronchodilator and anti-inflammatory effects, human studies on memory effects and its interaction with THC are limited.
   - **Studies:** A review in *Phytotherapy Research* discusses the potential anti-inflammatory and bronchodilator properties of pinene .

### 5. **Linalool**
   - **Scientific Support:** Linalool is well-known in **aromatherapy** for its **calming** and **sedative** effects. It has been extensively studied for its **anti-anxiety**, **sedative**, and **analgesic** effects. However, most of the studies have been conducted on animals or in vitro.
   - **Degree of Research:** Strong. Extensive research on its anti-anxiety effects exists, but more human clinical trials are necessary to substantiate its benefits in real-world conditions.
   - **Studies:** A study in *The International Journal of Molecular Sciences* supports its anti-inflammatory and anti-anxiety effects .

### 6. **Humulene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Humulene has been studied for its **anti-inflammatory** and **anti-cancer** properties in various preclinical models. Its role as an **appetite suppressant** is less well-studied, but it is suggested based on its use in traditional medicines and animal models.
   - **Degree of Research:** Limited to moderate. While humulene‚Äôs anti-inflammatory effects are backed by some research, there‚Äôs a lack of robust human studies.
   - **Studies:** A study published in *Frontiers in Pharmacology* highlighted its anti-inflammatory properties in vitro .

### 7. **Terpinolene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Terpinolene is known for its **antioxidant** and **sedative** properties in animal studies. It has shown potential as an **anti-cancer** agent in cell culture studies, but these findings are preliminary and need further validation in humans.
   - **Degree of Research:** Limited. Most studies on terpinolene‚Äôs effects have been conducted in vitro or on animals. Human trials are scarce.
   - **Studies:** A study in *Bioorganic & Medicinal Chemistry* showed that terpinolene might suppress cancer cell growth in vitro .

### 8. **Ocimene**
   - **Scientific Support:** Ocimene is less studied compared to other terpenes. It has shown **anti-inflammatory** and **antiviral** properties in lab studies, but these findings are mostly from in vitro experiments.
   - **Degree of Research:** Limited. There is a lack of robust clinical trials, and most findings are based on preliminary research.
   - **Studies:** Research published in *Natural Product Communications* examined ocimene‚Äôs potential as an antiviral agent .

### 9. **Bisabolol**
   - **Scientific Support:** Bisabolol, also found in chamomile, has been studied for its **skin-soothing**, **anti-inflammatory**, and **antimicrobial** effects. It is commonly used in skincare and cosmeceuticals for wound healing and inflammation relief.
   - **Degree of Research:** Strong. There‚Äôs substantial research in the dermatological field, especially for its use in skin products, though its broader medicinal effects are less studied in humans.
   - **Studies:** A study in the *Journal of the American Oil Chemists' Society* looked into its anti-inflammatory properties for skincare .

### Conclusion:
While many of the potential benefits of cannabis terpenes are backed by preclinical studies (often in vitro or on animals), most of the research is still in its early stages, especially when it comes to human trials. The therapeutic properties of terpenes like linalool, limonene, and caryophyllene are better understood due to more extensive research, whereas others, like ocimene and terpinolene, require more clinical validation.

Emitting Color: QBC 600 IR UV

The term **"Emitting Color: QBC 600 IR UV"** refers to a type of light-emitting diode (LED) or other light source with specific properties related to the wavelength of light it emits. Let's break it down:

1. **QBC**: This likely refers to the specific model or type of the LED or light source. It could also indicate a technology or brand related to the light-emitting component.

2. **600**: This number typically refers to the wavelength of light emitted, measured in nanometers (nm). A wavelength of **600 nm** falls in the **red** part of the visible light spectrum, close to the boundary with infrared (IR) light.

3. **IR (Infrared)**: This means the light source emits **infrared light**, which is beyond the visible spectrum for humans. IR is often used in applications like remote controls, night-vision devices, and thermal imaging.

4. **UV (Ultraviolet)**: This means the light source also emits **ultraviolet light**, which is at the opposite end of the spectrum from infrared and is not visible to the naked eye. UV light is used for sterilization, disinfection, and in some specialized lighting technologies like black lights.

### In summary:
The light source in question emits **600 nm red light**, **infrared (IR) light**, and **ultraviolet (UV) light**. This combination of light wavelengths could be used in various specialized applications, such as in medical or industrial equipment, agriculture, or even entertainment lighting setups.

If you're referring to a specific product, it could be an LED that offers multiple functionalities (IR and UV) within the same unit.
how powerful should my led be for weed growin?

The power of your LED grow light for cannabis cultivation depends on several factors, including the size of the grow space, the stage of plant growth, and the type of LED light (whether it's full spectrum, white light, or a combination of red and blue diodes). Here's a guide to help you determine how powerful your LED grow light should be:

### 1. **Grow Space Size**
LED grow lights are typically measured in **wattage per square foot**. The general rule is:

- **Vegetative stage**: 30‚Äì40 watts per square foot.
- **Flowering stage**: 50‚Äì70 watts per square foot.

Here‚Äôs an example of the wattage needed based on grow space:

- **2' x 2' space**: 120‚Äì200 watts.
- **3' x 3' space**: 270‚Äì400 watts.
- **4' x 4' space**: 500‚Äì650 watts.
  
### 2. **Plant Growth Stages**
- **Seedling and early vegetative stage**: Cannabis plants don't need as much light, so you can start with **lower wattage** (e.g., 30‚Äì40 watts per square foot).
  
- **Vegetative stage**: Plants require more intense light to grow strong, bushy foliage, but they are still focused on foliage rather than buds. You can provide **30‚Äì40 watts per square foot** during this phase.
  
- **Flowering stage**: During the flowering stage, plants need much more light to produce dense buds. At this point, you should increase the intensity to **50‚Äì70 watts per square foot** to maximize bud development.

### 3. **Full Spectrum LED Lights**
For cannabis growing, **full-spectrum LED lights** are often the best choice because they mimic natural sunlight and provide the necessary wavelengths for both the vegetative and flowering stages. Most modern LED grow lights are optimized for cannabis growth with full spectrum, including UV and infrared (IR) wavelengths for optimal plant development.

### 4. **PAR (Photosynthetically Active Radiation) and PPFD (Photosynthetic Photon Flux Density)**
Wattage is a rough estimate, but the true measure of how powerful your light should be depends on **PPFD** and **PAR** values. Ideally, for cannabis:

- **Vegetative stage**: PPFD of **200‚Äì400 ¬µmol/m¬≤/s**.
- **Flowering stage**: PPFD of **600‚Äì900 ¬µmol/m¬≤/s**.

Many high-quality LED lights come with these specifications to ensure they provide the right intensity for the plants at different stages.

### 5. **Distance from Plants**
You need to maintain the correct distance between the LED light and the cannabis canopy:

- **Seedlings**: 24‚Äì30 inches away.
- **Vegetative stage**: 18‚Äì24 inches away.
- **Flowering stage**: 12‚Äì18 inches away.

Ensure that your light is neither too close (which could burn the plants) nor too far (which could result in weak growth).

### 6. **Efficiency vs. Wattage**
Not all LEDs are created equal. Some high-efficiency LEDs can produce more light with fewer watts. So, while wattage is a guide, the quality of the light matters just as much. Look for LEDs with high energy efficiency, measured in lumens per watt or in terms of **PPF (Photosynthetic Photon Flux)**.

### Summary:
For most small indoor cannabis grows (3' x 3' or 4' x 4'), an LED grow light of **300‚Äì600 watts** should be sufficient, depending on the growth stage. For larger grows, you may need multiple lights or higher wattage (up to 1000 watts for larger tents).

When choosing an LED, consider its **full spectrum**, **wattage per square foot**, and efficiency (PPF or PPFD) to ensure you provide the best possible light for your cannabis plants.

Here‚Äôs a more detailed breakdown of the scientific support behind each of the specific terpenes you mentioned:

### 1. **Myrcene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Sedation & Muscle Relaxation:** Myrcene is known for its sedative properties, which have been shown in rodent studies. It also enhances the muscle-relaxant effects of other compounds like THC, leading to a relaxed and "couch-lock" effect.
     - **Pain Relief (Analgesic):** Animal studies have demonstrated that myrcene has analgesic properties, especially when used in conjunction with cannabinoids.
     - **Anti-inflammatory:** There is some evidence suggesting that myrcene may reduce inflammation, although this is mostly based on preclinical data.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Moderate. Most evidence comes from animal studies, with limited human research. More clinical trials are needed to confirm these effects in humans.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - A study published in the *Journal of Phytotherapy Research* found myrcene has sedative and pain-relieving effects in animal models.

### 2. **Caryophyllene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Anti-inflammatory:** Caryophyllene is a unique terpene because it can bind to **CB2 receptors** in the endocannabinoid system, helping regulate inflammation. This has been demonstrated in preclinical models.
     - **Pain Relief (Analgesic):** Caryophyllene‚Äôs interaction with CB2 receptors has also been linked to pain relief, with animal studies supporting its use as an analgesic.
     - **Anti-anxiety:** Its interaction with the endocannabinoid system may help reduce anxiety, although evidence is limited to preclinical studies.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Strong. Caryophyllene has been studied extensively for its anti-inflammatory properties, both in vitro and in animal models. Early human studies are also underway.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - A study in *Pharmacology & Pharmacy* discussed caryophyllene‚Äôs activation of CB2 receptors and its potential anti-inflammatory benefits.

### 3. **Limonene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Mood Enhancement & Anti-anxiety:** Limonene has been shown in animal models to have anti-anxiety effects. Early-stage human studies support these findings, though more research is needed to confirm this.
     - **Antibacterial & Antifungal:** Laboratory studies have demonstrated that limonene has significant antimicrobial properties, particularly against certain bacteria and fungi.
     - **Digestive Aid:** Limonene is also used in traditional medicine for its digestive properties, though scientific evidence supporting this is still developing.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Strong for antimicrobial properties, moderate for mood enhancement. Preclinical research supports its mood-enhancing and anti-anxiety effects, but large-scale human trials are still limited.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - Research in *Advances in Experimental Medicine and Biology* has confirmed the anti-anxiety effects of limonene in preclinical trials.

### 4. **Terpinolene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Antioxidant:** Terpinolene has shown antioxidant effects in laboratory studies, which suggests it may protect cells from oxidative damage.
     - **Sedative:** This terpene is mildly sedative, and may contribute to the calming effects of some cannabis strains. Most of the evidence for its sedative properties comes from animal models.
     - **Anticancer Potential:** Some preliminary studies have suggested terpinolene may have anticancer properties, though most research has been conducted in vitro (in cell cultures).
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Limited. The antioxidant and anticancer potential of terpinolene have been primarily explored in vitro or animal models, with little human-based research.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - A study in *Bioorganic & Medicinal Chemistry* discussed the antioxidant properties of terpinolene and its potential to suppress cancer cell proliferation in vitro.

### 5. **Pinene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Bronchodilator:** Pinene is known to improve airflow in the lungs, making it a potential treatment for respiratory conditions like asthma. This has been demonstrated in animal studies and traditional medicine.
     - **Anti-inflammatory:** Pinene has shown anti-inflammatory properties in preclinical studies, especially in the context of reducing inflammation in the lungs and respiratory system.
     - **Memory Support:** There‚Äôs some evidence, mostly anecdotal, that pinene may counteract the short-term memory impairment caused by THC. However, this needs more scientific validation.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Moderate. Pinene‚Äôs bronchodilator effects are well-established in animal studies and supported by traditional use, but human clinical trials on its effects in memory support are lacking.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - Research in *Phytotherapy Research* reviewed pinene‚Äôs anti-inflammatory and bronchodilator effects.

### 6. **Ocimene**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Antiviral & Antifungal:** Ocimene has shown antiviral and antifungal properties in laboratory studies. These findings suggest it could potentially help the immune system in fighting infections.
     - **Anti-inflammatory:** There is some preliminary evidence of ocimene‚Äôs anti-inflammatory properties, but this is largely based on preclinical models.
     - **Decongestant:** Anecdotally, ocimene is used for its potential decongestant effects, though this benefit lacks significant scientific backing.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Limited. While ocimene has shown antiviral and antifungal properties in lab-based studies, its broader medicinal potential is under-researched, with little human-based evidence.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - A study published in *Natural Product Communications* explored ocimene‚Äôs antiviral properties in vitro.

### 7. **Linalool**
   - **Potential Benefits:**
     - **Anti-anxiety & Sedation:** Linalool is extensively studied for its calming effects. Animal models show strong anti-anxiety and sedative effects, and its use in aromatherapy is well-established.
     - **Pain Relief (Analgesic):** Linalool has shown potential as a pain reliever in both preclinical studies and human studies involving topical applications.
     - **Anti-inflammatory:** Some studies suggest that linalool can reduce inflammation, but this is mostly based on animal studies.
   - **Degree of Scientific Support:** Strong. Linalool‚Äôs anti-anxiety and sedative effects are well-supported by preclinical research and human use in aromatherapy. However, more large-scale human trials are needed to fully confirm these effects in a clinical setting.
   - **Key Studies:**
     - Research in *The International Journal of Molecular Sciences* examined linalool‚Äôs potential as an anti-anxiety and anti-inflammatory agent.

### Conclusion:
The scientific support behind each of these terpenes varies, with caryophyllene, limonene, and linalool having stronger research bases due to their unique properties and extensive use in traditional medicine and preliminary clinical trials. Others, like ocimene and terpinolene, require more research to validate their effects in humans, as much of the current data is preclinical or in vitro.

When considering cannabis terpenes for diurnal use‚Äîsuch as during work, exercise, or other daytime activities‚Äîthe goal is to focus on terpenes that promote **alertness, focus, energy, and mood elevation** while avoiding those that are overly sedative or relaxing. Based on these criteria, here are some terpenes that are more suitable for daytime use:

### 1. **Pinene**
   - **Best For:** Alertness, focus, and respiratory function (great for workouts).
   - **Why:** Pinene is known to enhance focus and memory retention. It's also a **bronchodilator**, which can help improve airflow, making it beneficial for physical activity like gym workouts or outdoor activities.
   - **Effects:** Clear-headed, increased alertness, and potentially improved memory. It may counteract some of the short-term memory impairment caused by THC.
   - **Good For:** Work (focus), gym (respiratory function), and outdoor activities.

### 2. **Limonene**
   - **Best For:** Uplifting mood, energy, and stress reduction.
   - **Why:** Limonene has a **citrusy, refreshing aroma** that can elevate mood and reduce stress or anxiety. It's commonly found in energizing, sativa-dominant strains that are good for daytime use.
   - **Effects:** Boosts energy, promotes positive mood, and reduces stress.
   - **Good For:** Work (focus and mood enhancement), gym (energy boost), or any activity requiring creativity and social interaction.

### 3. **Caryophyllene**
   - **Best For:** Anti-inflammatory benefits without sedation.
   - **Why:** Caryophyllene's **anti-inflammatory** properties can help with physical recovery after exercise without causing drowsiness. It also has some mild **anxiolytic** (anti-anxiety) effects, which may help keep you calm yet focused during the day.
   - **Effects:** Balanced, calm, and grounded, without causing fatigue.
   - **Good For:** Work (focus and calmness), gym (anti-inflammatory recovery after workouts), or any situation where mental calmness is needed.

### 4. **Ocimene**
   - **Best For:** Energy and alertness.
   - **Why:** Ocimene is known for its **uplifting and energizing effects**, which makes it suitable for staying active or social during the day. Its **herbal, sweet** aroma adds to the refreshing experience.
   - **Effects:** Light, energetic, and uplifting.
   - **Good For:** Work (focus and creativity), gym (energy boost), or social activities.

### 5. **Terpinolene** (in low doses)
   - **Best For:** Subtle energy and mental clarity.
   - **Why:** Terpinolene can have mildly stimulating and **energizing effects**, especially when consumed in moderation. It is known to promote a **creative, clear-headed experience**, which is helpful for tasks requiring mental engagement.
   - **Effects:** Light stimulation, mental clarity, and subtle energy boost.
   - **Good For:** Creative work (mental clarity), gym (light boost of energy), or social engagements.

---

### **Best Overall Terpenes for Specific Activities:**
- **Work (Focus, Creativity, Calmness):** **Pinene**, **Limonene**, and **Caryophyllene** are ideal for staying focused and calm without being sedated.
- **Gym (Energy, Physical Endurance):** **Pinene** (for respiratory benefits), **Limonene** (for mood and energy), and **Caryophyllene** (for post-workout inflammation recovery) are great.
- **Social Settings (Uplifting, Sociable):** **Limonene**, **Ocimene**, and **Terpinolene** (in moderation) are good for staying upbeat and energized in social situations.

### Terpenes to Avoid for Diurnal Use:
- **Myrcene** and **Linalool** are more sedative and relaxing, which could interfere with focus or energy during the day, making them better suited for evening use.

For optimal daytime performance, a combination of **Pinene** (focus), **Limonene** (energy), and **Caryophyllene** (calm focus and anti-inflammatory) would be excellent for balancing energy, mood, and mental clarity.

**CBG (Cannabigerol)** is a **non-psychoactive cannabinoid** found in the cannabis plant. It's often referred to as the "mother of all cannabinoids" because it's the precursor to other cannabinoids, including THC (tetrahydrocannabinol), CBD (cannabidiol), and CBC (cannabichromene). In its acidic form, CBG exists as **CBGA (cannabigerolic acid)**, which, through a process called decarboxylation, gets converted into these other cannabinoids as the cannabis plant matures.

### Key Points About CBG:
- **Non-psychoactive:** Unlike THC, CBG does not produce the "high" typically associated with cannabis.
- **Present in Low Quantities:** CBG is typically found in much lower concentrations than THC or CBD in most cannabis strains. However, some strains are bred specifically to be rich in CBG.
- **Cannabinoid Precursor:** CBGA, the acidic form of CBG, breaks down to form major cannabinoids like THC, CBD, and CBC, making it crucial in the biochemical development of the plant.

### **Potential Benefits of CBG (Backed by Research):**
1. **Anti-inflammatory:** CBG has shown potential to reduce inflammation, particularly in conditions like **inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)**.
   - **Studies:** Research published in the *Biochemical Pharmacology Journal* suggested that CBG has anti-inflammatory effects in animal models of IBD.
   
2. **Neuroprotective Properties:** Some studies suggest that CBG may protect nerve cells, particularly in conditions like **Huntington‚Äôs disease**, where neurodegeneration occurs.
   - **Studies:** Research in *Neurotherapeutics* demonstrated that CBG has neuroprotective properties in a mouse model of Huntington‚Äôs disease.

3. **Antibacterial Effects:** CBG has shown strong potential as an **antibacterial agent**, particularly against drug-resistant bacteria like **MRSA** (Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus).
   - **Studies:** A study published in *Frontiers in Microbiology* highlighted CBG‚Äôs effectiveness against antibiotic-resistant bacteria.

4. **Appetite Stimulant:** Some animal studies suggest that CBG can act as an **appetite stimulant**, making it useful for people with appetite-related conditions (similar to THC but without the psychoactive effects).
   - **Studies:** In animal models, CBG increased food intake, suggesting potential therapeutic applications for conditions like **cachexia** or **anorexia**.

5. **Glaucoma:** CBG has been shown to reduce **intraocular pressure**, making it a potential treatment for **glaucoma**.
   - **Studies:** Early research from the 1990s suggested that CBG could reduce intraocular pressure in the eyes of glaucoma patients.

6. **Cancer-Fighting Potential:** Preliminary studies indicate that CBG might inhibit the growth of cancer cells, specifically in **colon cancer** models.
   - **Studies:** A study published in *Carcinogenesis* found that CBG inhibited the growth of colorectal cancer cells in animal models.

### How Does CBG Differ From CBD?
- **Interaction with the Endocannabinoid System:** Both CBG and CBD interact with the body‚Äôs **endocannabinoid system** but in different ways. CBG primarily binds to **CB1** and **CB2** receptors, much like THC, but without causing psychoactive effects.
- **Focus of Effects:** While both CBG and CBD have anti-inflammatory and neuroprotective properties, CBG tends to be more effective for specific conditions, such as glaucoma, inflammatory bowel disease, and bacterial infections.
- **Prevalence:** CBD is much more abundant in most cannabis strains, while CBG is typically present in smaller amounts unless the plant is specifically bred to produce more CBG.

### Future of CBG:
Given its diverse range of potential therapeutic applications, CBG is becoming a point of focus in both medical research and cannabis cultivation. As demand grows, more strains with higher CBG content are being bred, and its use in health and wellness products is likely to increase.

In summary, **CBG** is a promising cannabinoid with various potential health benefits, especially for **inflammation**, **neuroprotection**, **glaucoma**, and **antibacterial properties**. While research is still in the early stages compared to CBD and THC, CBG is gaining attention for its therapeutic potential.
